p: In this study, the methanolic extract of C. auriculata showed the highest ferric reducing antioxidant power, followed by ethanol, chloroform, and aqueous extracts as shown in Table 4 , and the inhibitory concentrations were found to be close to those of standards. The IC 50 values of methanolic, ethanol, chloroform, and aqueous extracts were 47.13 ± 0.37, 52.44 ± 0.46, 67.59 ± 0.75, and 95.68 ± 1.50 μg/mL, respectively, indicating that the methanol extract has more antioxidant potency than the other extracts of the root studied.
